title: Injured Lillard Headlines Sportsbooks‚Äô Favorites for NBA All-Star Weekend
description: Damian Lillard has yet to play this season due to a torn Achilles but is the favorite to win the 3-Point Contest on Saturday.
fullText:
As NBA All-Star Weekend approaches, sportsbooks have set the stage with favorites and underdogs in the 3-Point Contest, Slam Dunk contest, and other festivities.

Lillard has a 54.5% implied chance to reach the 3-Point Contest final.

Three of the four Slam Dunk contest participants are rookies.

The NBA will host the first ever three-team All-Star Game tournament.

After an estimated $1.76 billion was wagered on Super Bowl LX, the NBA world heads into its celebratory midyear pause.

This time of year is known for high-flying acts in the Slam Dunk contest, precision sharpshooting in the 3-Point Contest, the craftsmanship of the Skills Challenge, and, for the first time ever, a three-team All-Star Game tournament.

Kicking it off with the Slam Dunk contest, the top online sportsbooks can‚Äôt decide on a consensus favorite.

Gone are the days of the NBA‚Äôs biggest and brightest stars competing in the contest. Bryant, Johnson, and Richardson are all rookies, leaving 25-year-old and seven-year veteran Hayes as the group‚Äôs senior.

Hayes is also the most productive of the quartet, averaging a modest 6.5 points per game. However, he‚Äôs thrown down several highlight-worthy dunks in his career, including an Eastbay on Jan. 26.

This isn't Jaxson Hayes' first Eastbay...

He went between the legs for the slam on April 2, 2024 ü§Ø https://t.co/9IhnKU2Hr0 pic.twitter.com/x6DBABBBdr

The 3-Point Contest, meanwhile, is headlined by a player who could provide one of the best All-Star Weekend storylines in recent memory.

Lillard hasn‚Äôt appeared in an NBA game since he tore his Achilles in the Eastern Conference quarterfinals April 27. Despite that, he finds himself as the favorite or co-favorite at the two top sportsbooks and the only player with minus-money odds (-120) at FanDuel to qualify for the final round.

The longtime Portland Trail Blazers stalwart won the event in 2023 and 2024.

Damian Lillard wins the NBA Three-Point Contest üî•pic.twitter.com/0MCKjFOs7y

‚Äî Daily Loud (@DailyLoud) February 19, 2023

Notably, Charlotte Hornets rookie Kon Knueppel is second. A win would make him the first player in franchise history to hoist the trophy.

The Skills Challenge is being replaced by the Shooting Stars competition, which has not been seen at All-Star Weekend since 2015.

The competition will see three-person teams compete to score points by nailing jumpers from designated areas on the court. The last team to win was Team Bosh, which consisted of Chris Bosh, Dominique Wilkins, and Swin Cash.

Teams competing in this year‚Äôs event include:

Team Knicks: Jalen Brunson, Karl-Anthony Towns, Allan Houston
Team Cameron: Kon Kneuppel, Jalen Johnson, Corey Maggette
Team All-Stars: Scottie Barnes, Chet Holmgren, Richard Hamilton
Team Harper: Dylan Harper, Ron Harper, Ron Harper Jr.

The new All-Star Game round-robin tournament will see three teams compete in four 12-minute games. The top two teams based on the aggregate score of their matchups will advance to the championship round, where they will play a final 12-minute contest.

While FanDuel and DraftKings are split on which team will win the mini-tournament, they agree that USA Stars are the long shot.

The teams and individuals who will take the floor include:

USA Stars: Scottie Barnes, Devin Booker, Cade Cunningham, Jalen Duren, Anthony Edwards, Chet Holmgren, Jalen Johnson, Tyrese Maxey
USA Stripes: Jaylen Brown, Jalen Brunson, Brandon Ingram, Kevin Durant, LeBron James, Kawhi Leonard, Donovan Mitchell, Norman Powell
World: Giannis Antetokounmpo, Deni Avdija, Luka Doncic, Shai Gilgeous-Alexander, Nikola Jokic, Jamal Murray, Alperen Sengun, Pascal Siakam, Karl-Anthony Towns, Victor Wembanyama

title: Isaiah Stewart running to punch Miles Bridges has NBA fans going crazy
description: Isaiah Stewart sprinting across the court to confront Miles Bridges during a heated Pistons-Hornets clash has sent NBA fans into meltdown. The chaotic moment quickly overshadowed the game itself, with video clips spreading faster than officials could regain control.
fullText:
Isaiah Stewart sprinting across the court to confront Miles Bridges during a heated Pistons-Hornets clash has sent NBA fans into meltdown.

The chaotic moment quickly overshadowed the game itself, with video clips spreading faster than officials could regain control.

Footage shared by Legion Hoops captured the exact moment Isaiah Stewart broke into a full sprint toward Miles Bridges as tensions boiled over.

The incident unfolded during a dead ball after Bridges became involved in an altercation with Pistons big man Jalen Duren. As players converged, Stewart rushed in from a distance, escalating the confrontation within seconds.

According to the official NBA report, Stewart, Bridges, Duren, and Charlotte‚Äôs Moussa Diabate were all ejected for fighting activity. The situation deteriorated so rapidly that officials had little choice but to clear multiple players from the floor.

The chaos did not stop there. Hornets head coach Charles Lee was also ejected later in the fourth quarter after aggressively approaching an official and needing to be restrained by his own player.

For Stewart, the moment reinforced a growing reputation. His willingness to jump into confrontations has become a defining part of his on-court identity, particularly in emotionally charged games.

Fan reaction online was immediate and polarising. Some drew dramatic historical comparisons, with one writing, ‚ÄúMalice the Palace 2.0,‚Äù referencing the league‚Äôs most infamous brawl.

Others focused on the league‚Äôs image. ‚ÄúThis is not a good sight for the game,‚Äù one fan commented, echoing concerns about optics and discipline.

Not everyone disapproved. Some embraced the chaos, with one post reading, ‚ÄúIsaiah Stewart will always be doing ts, and I love it.‚Äù That sentiment reflected a segment of fans who admire Stewart‚Äôs raw intensity.

There was also speculation about consequences. ‚ÄúMr. Silver may make an example out of him,‚Äù one fan wrote, anticipating potential league discipline given Stewart‚Äôs history.

Another summed up the pattern bluntly. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve never seen Isaiah Stewart‚Äôs video on the TL without a fight.‚Äù The comment captured how frequently Stewart finds himself at the center of viral confrontations.

With punches reportedly thrown and multiple ejections issued, the incident is now firmly on the NBA‚Äôs radar. Suspensions and fines remain possible as the league reviews the footage.

title: NBA Power Rankings ahead of 2026 All-Star Break
description: The trade deadline was Thursday, February 5th, and many players made the move to new destinations. Certain teams tried to solidify their rosters for the playoffs, while others did complete teardowns in return for future draft assets. With the trade‚Ä¶
fullText:
The trade deadline was Thursday, February 5th, and many players made the move to new destinations. Certain teams tried to solidify their rosters for the playoffs, while others did complete teardowns in return for future draft assets. With the trade deadline in the rearview window, the league has three days of games before the 2026 All-Star break from February 13 to February 19.

Upon returning to game action, the playoff hunt will be in full force. Here are the NBA team power rankings heading into Week 17.

Sacramento needs to get younger. The Kings‚Äô starting rotation does not include any young superstars, and the bench lacks high-upside depth. The team fails to post high outputs on offense and lacks the ability to prevent opponents from scoring.

MORE: Former NBA champion Anthony Davis dealt in blockbuster trade

New Orleans is near the bottom in points per game and almost dead last in points allowed per game. The front office‚Äôs moves haven‚Äôt worked since Zion Williamson was drafted in 2019. The organization must find a way to offload Williamson, Dejounte Murray, and any other veteran players to acquire future draft picks.

The Pacers have had the brutal season that was expected. The team lost their court general, Tyrese Haliburton, during last year‚Äôs NBA Finals, and it‚Äôs clear the team has no plans to rush him back this season. During Thursday‚Äôs trade deadline, the front office acquired veteran center Ivica Zubac for unrestricted free agent Bennedict Mathurin and two first-round picks. This move sets Indiana up for next season and beyond.

Washington is one of the league‚Äôs worst in offense and defense. The team made another big splash last Thursday, acquiring Anthony Davis from Dallas. Once healthy, the Wizards‚Äô starting lineup will feature Trae Young and Anthony Davis.

The Nets are dead last in points per game, and one of their best scorers, Cam Thomas, has missed more than half of the team‚Äôs games due to injury. Now is the time to add draft capital as the team has two first-round picks in 2027, 2028, and 2029. Brooklyn must hit on upcoming draft picks.

As of last Monday, Utah looked poised to trade forward Lauri Markkanen. The Jazz went another direction, acquiring Jaren Jackson Jr. on Tuesday. Jackson Jr. immediately bolsters the roster heading into next season.

Last season‚Äôs deal that sent Luka Doncic to Los Angeles looks worse after last week. On Wednesday, Dallas sent Anthony Davis to Washington for a return of players, including Khris Middleton, two first-round picks, and three second-round picks. Between the trades of Doncic and Davis, the Mavericks did not receive a young player with high upside.

Memphis traded Jaren Jackson Jr. last Tuesday, and shipping Ja Morant in an offseason trade will set the franchise in full rebuild mode. The Grizzlies have taken a 180 following last season‚Äôs dismissal of head coach Taylor Jenkins. Jenkins led the team to three consecutive playoff appearances from 2020 to 2022.

The weeks leading up to last Thursday‚Äôs trade deadline were headlined by Milwaukee potentially trading Giannis Antetokounmpo. The team fielded calls but decided no offers were good enough. The front office needs offseason upgrades, but the team‚Äôs superstar may force his way out this summer.

Chicago underwent a full teardown by the trade deadline. However, the team did not receive a single first-round pick in any trade. The Bulls will use their salary cap in the upcoming offseasons while packaging a plethora of second-round picks in future trades.

Charlotte‚Äôs front office saw that the team was near the playoffs and added at the trade deadline. The team acquired Coby White from Chicago and Tyus Jones from Orlando. White and Jones add depth to the Hornets‚Äô offense that ranks 11th in points per game.

Los Angeles is in playoff contention and decided to move 36-year-old James Harden to Cleveland for point guard Darius Garland. Thursday‚Äôs deadline saw the team move veteran Ivica Zubac to Indiana for Bennedict Mathurin, Isaiah Jackson, and two first-round picks. The moves signaled the Clippers were unwilling to give Harden another big payday, and now is the time to rebuild the roster around younger players.

The Trail Blazers have struggled over the past two weeks but are contending for the play-in tournament. The front office didn‚Äôt make a move at the trade deadline, holding onto future draft picks. If Portland can improve defensively, they can reach the playoffs following the play-in tournament.

Atlanta acquired offensive pieces after trading Kristaps Porzingis to Golden State for Jonathan Kuminga and Buddy Hield. The additions of Kuminga and Hield upgrade the team‚Äôs depth. The Hawks are in contention to make it out of the Eastern Conference play-in tournament.

Orlando‚Äôs main objective as the season continues is to have its roster healthy for the play-in tournament. The talent is there, and the Magic will be a tough matchup in the postseason. The team can make a push for the final playoff spot in the Eastern Conference.

Offensively, Miami ranks in the top five in points per game and will compete with any opposing team. The Heat‚Äôs issues start on defense. The team ranks near the bottom of the league in points allowed per game.

Golden State moved disgruntled forward Jonathan Kuminga and guard Buddy Hield for center Kristaps Porzingis. They were unable to achieve the rumored deal to land Giannis Antetokounmpo from Milwaukee. The Warriors will continue feeling the loss of Jimmy Butler and will be lucky to get past the first round of the playoffs should they survive the play-in tournament.

The Raptors continue to march in the right direction. Their offense isn‚Äôt among the league‚Äôs best, but they haven‚Äôt dealt with serious injuries, and the defense ranks in the top 10. Improvements to the offense will lead Toronto to success as the season finishes out.

The 76ers didn‚Äôt make any splashes at the trade deadline but moved Jared McCain to the Thunder for a 2026 first-round pick and three second-round picks. Philadelphia is currently sitting in a playoff spot and needs a strong finish to the season. The team‚Äôs lack of depth may be their downfall in the playoffs.

Phoenix has had a strong season and is hovering between a spot in the playoffs and the play-in tournament. The Suns‚Äô defense has been a strong suit this season. Entering the playoffs healthy makes Phoenix a tough matchup for any opposing team.

Los Angeles continues to battle Phoenix for a solidified spot in the playoffs or a trip to the play-in tournament. Defensive lapses have caused the Lakers issues this season, but the team continues to rebound. This may be LeBron James‚Äôs last shot at another title.

The Timberwolves added a depth piece when they acquired Ayo Dosunmu from the Bulls. Dosunmu gives the team versatility as a ball handler or shooting guard. Minnesota is ready to spring into the postseason.

Since the end of December, Cleveland has gone on a run. The Cavaliers have moved up the Eastern Conference standings and are resembling the strong team they had last season. Ahead of last week‚Äôs trade deadline, the team acquired James Harden in exchange for Darius Garland. Harden gives the team a reliable option on offense.

The Rockets continue their consistent play and are one of the league‚Äôs best defensive teams. The team didn‚Äôt make any trade deadline deals and feels content with the current state of the roster. Houston can be a contender for the Western Conference Finals if Kevin Durant is healthy.

Denver is one of the three best teams in the Western Conference. Nikola Jokic missed time a month ago, but Jamal Murray picked up the slack as he‚Äôs having the best season of his career and earned his first All-Star selection. A healthy Denver team, led by Nikola Jokic, can beat anyone in the playoffs.

Boston continues to be one of the Eastern Conference‚Äôs top teams after many expected the team to struggle following Jayson Tatum‚Äôs injury in last season‚Äôs playoffs. Needing an upgrade at center, the Celtics acquired Nikola Vucevic from the Bulls. Boston has the talent to reach the Eastern Conference Finals.

One of the league‚Äôs best on offense and defense, New York is ready to chase Detroit for the top spot in the Eastern Conference. The Knicks were close to reaching the NBA Finals last season and have unfinished business. If New York and Detroit face off in the conference finals, the Knicks‚Äô experience may give them the edge in the series.

San Antonio has been near the top of the Western Conference throughout the season. Victor Wembanyama has stayed healthy and is leading the team. Wembanyama‚Äôs previous seasons have ended following the All-Star Break. If the Spurs want to be serious title contenders, they must do everything in their power to keep Victor Wembanyama on the court.

Detroit has sat atop the Eastern Conference for most of the season. The team has produced a top 10 offense and a top 3 defense. The front office added a much-needed three-point shooter, acquiring Kevin Huerter from the Bulls.

Oklahoma City has been the favorite to win the championship throughout the season. They lead the league in points scored and points allowed per game. The front office added a high-upside depth piece when they acquired Jared McCain from Philadelphia at the trade deadline.

title: 'It kind of spiralled' - four ejected after mass brawl
description: Four players are ejected after a mass brawl as the Detroit Pistons beat the Charlotte Hornets 110-104 in a bad-tempered NBA fixture.
fullText:
Four players were ejected after a mass brawl as the Detroit Pistons beat the Charlotte Hornets 110-104 in a bad-tempered NBA fixture.

Detroit's Jalen Duren was fouled by Charlotte's Moussa Diabate during the third quarter, with the pair then confronting one another and appearing to butt heads.

Diabate had to be held back as he tried to hit Duren, before several other players got involved in the incident.

Detroit forward Isaiah Stewart confronted Charlotte's Miles Bridges and put him in a headlock before appearing to strike him multiple times.

The brawl lasted about 30 seconds, ending with a brief police presence on the floor.

Diabate, Duren, Stewart and Bridges were ejected - and Hornets coach Charles Lee was kicked out in the fourth quarter after he had to be restrained while angrily shouting at the officials having disagreed with a decision.

"Emotions were flaring. At the end of the day, we would love to keep it basketball, but things happen. Everybody was just playing hard," Duren said after the match.

"This isn't the first time that people have tried to be like extra aggressive with us and talk to us, whatever the case may be.

"At the end of the day, emotions got high with everybody being competitive. Things happen."

Bridges later apologised to fans, writing on Instagram: "Sorry Hornets nation! Sorry Hornets Organization! Always going to protect my team-mates forever."

Lead official John Goble said in a post-game report the players were ejected because they "engaged in fighting activity during the dead ball".

"After review, we assessed fighting fouls, and by rule, they were ejected from the game," he added.

Lee, asked about the clash between Diabate and Duren that triggered the wider brawl, said: "Two guys got in a heated conversation and then it kind of spiralled from there."

Of his own ejection in the fourth quarter, Lee added: "I've got to have a little bit better emotional control in that moment."

Elsewhere, Golden State Warriors' Steph Curry will miss Sunday's All-Star game with an injury to his right knee.

However, the Warriors are hopeful Curry will return after the All-Star break for the game against the Boston Celtics on 19 February.

title: Jalen Williams returns from injury, leads Thunder past Lakers 119-110 with SGA, Luka sidelined
description: Jalen Williams scored 15 of his 23 points in the second half of his return from a 10-game injury absence, and the Oklahoma City Thunder snapped their two-game skid with a 119-110 victory over the Los Angeles Lakers on Monday night.  Reigning league MVP Shai Gilgeous-Alexander and current NBA scoring leader Luka Doncic both sat out due to injuries, leaving their supporting casts to play a Thunder-style physical game featuring 52 combined free throws.  LeBron James scored 14 of his 22 points in the second half for the Lakers, whose three-game winning streak ended with another ineffective defensive performance.
fullText:
LOS ANGELES (AP) ‚Äî Jalen Williams scored 15 of his 23 points in the second half of his return from a 10-game injury absence, and the Oklahoma City Thunder snapped their two-game skid with a 119-110 victory over the Los Angeles Lakers on Monday night.

Reigning league MVP Shai Gilgeous-Alexander and current NBA scoring leader Luka Doncic both sat out due to injuries, leaving their supporting casts to play a Thunder-style physical game featuring 52 combined free throws.

LeBron James scored 14 of his 22 points in the second half for the Lakers, whose three-game winning streak ended with another ineffective defensive performance.

Jalen Williams, who had been out with a hamstring strain, and Jaylin Williams both hit big jumpers while the Thunder broke open a close game down the stretch. Chet Holmgren added a key put-back dunk with 1:17 to play for the NBA-leading Thunder, who had lost three of five.

Isaiah Joe scored 19 points and Alex Caruso added 17 from Oklahoma City's bench. Holmgren had 13 points and 10 rebounds.

Marcus Smart scored 19 points and Austin Reaves had 16 on a minutes restriction for Los Angeles, which dropped to a pedestrian 14-9 at home.

Jared McCain scored on his first two possessions and finished with seven points in his second game for the Thunder, who acquired the guard from Philadelphia by trade last week.

Gilgeous-Alexander's abdominal injury will keep him out through the All-Star Game this weekend in Inglewood, California. The Lakers haven't determined how long they'll be without Doncic, who missed his second straight game with a mild hamstring strain.

Thunder: At Phoenix on Wednesday.

Lakers: Host San Antonio on Wednesday.

fullText:
The Charlotte Hornets and the Detroit Pistons put on a show Monday night, and it had little to do with basketball. In the third quarter, players from both sides got into an all-out brawl that baffled spectators, and other NBA players who later saw the footage had strong reactions as well.

Moments later, Isaiah Stewart came running from the Pistons bench and got into it with Miles Bridges, who had also stepped into the fray. The chaos ultimately led to all four players being ejected.

Jaylen Brown was at home, streaming. And with the Hornets vs. Pistons brawl being the talk of the town, he decided to react to it.

The Celtics star understood why Diabate lost his cool. In the heat of the moment, he said that when someone ‚Äúmushes‚Äù or shoves another player‚Äôs face, it can make your blood boil. Brown even hinted that he might have reacted the same way if he were in Diabate‚Äôs position.

‚ÄúIf a dude takes his hand and mush your face like that‚Ä¶ I ain‚Äôt gon lie, somebody gotta die,‚Äù Brown declared, treating the mushing of one‚Äôs face as the ultimate disrespect.

title: Los Angeles Lakers players who led NBA in scoring
description: Throughout NBA history, the Los Angeles Lakers have been home to some of the most dominant scorers the game has ever seen. From the league‚Äôs earliest days to the modern era, Lakers stars have not only carried their team offensively‚Ä¶
fullText:
Throughout NBA history, the Los Angeles Lakers have been home to some of the most dominant scorers the game has ever seen. From the league‚Äôs earliest days to the modern era, Lakers stars have not only carried their team offensively but also set the scoring standard for the entire NBA. Leading the league in scoring while wearing purple and gold has always signaled a season of individual brilliance and historical significance.

2025‚Äì26: 33.5 PPG (current pace)

In his first season wearing a Lakers uniform, Doncic immediately established himself as the league‚Äôs most dominant offensive force. His scoring lead reflects a rare blend of volume, efficiency, and creativity, as he punishes defenses at all three levels. Luka‚Äôs ability to control tempo while still producing elite numbers makes this season feel both historic and sustainable. If the pace holds, it would be one of the most impressive scoring campaigns in franchise history.

Kobe‚Äôs back-to-back scoring titles represent the apex of his individual offensive dominance. The 2004‚Äì05 season showcased his unmatched shot-making and willingness to shoulder the entire offensive burden. In 2005‚Äì06, he followed it up with another scoring crown, highlighted by legendary performances and relentless competitiveness. These seasons cemented Bryant as the most feared scorer of his era.

Shaq‚Äôs scoring title came during the lockout-shortened season, where his physical dominance was simply overwhelming. Defenses had no answer for his combination of size, power, and touch around the rim. Night after night, opponents were forced to foul or concede easy points. This season set the stage for the Lakers‚Äô upcoming dynasty.

Jerry West led the league in scoring during a period defined by tough defense and limited spacing, making his numbers even more remarkable. His offensive game was built on precision, footwork, and an unshakable confidence in big moments. West carried the Lakers with consistency and poise, embodying the prototype of a complete guard. This season further solidified his legacy as one of the greatest scorers of his generation.

George Mikan was the NBA‚Äôs first true dominant scorer and the foundation of the Lakers‚Äô early success. His three consecutive scoring titles came at a time when the league was still defining itself, and Mikan was clearly ahead of his peers. He forced rule changes, reshaped defensive strategies, and established the center position as the game‚Äôs focal point. These seasons made him the original face of Lakers greatness.

Each Lakers player who led the NBA in scoring reflects a different era, style, and evolution of the game, yet all share the same impact: offensive supremacy. Whether through finesse, power, or relentless shot-making, these seasons stand as benchmarks of greatness within the franchise‚Äôs storied legacy. Together, they reinforce why the Lakers remain synonymous with elite scorers and unforgettable individual performances.

title: NBA 2026 Three-point contest participants
description: The 2026 NBA Three-Point Contest brings together a compelling mix of proven champions, first-time participants, and rising shooters who reflect how central the long ball has become in today‚Äôs game. From seasoned All-Stars with past hardware to young players eager‚Ä¶
fullText:
The 2026 NBA Three-Point Contest brings together a compelling mix of proven champions, first-time participants, and rising shooters who reflect how central the long ball has become in today‚Äôs game. From seasoned All-Stars with past hardware to young players eager to announce themselves on a national stage, this field is stacked with both credibility and intrigue. Each competitor enters with a distinct shooting profile, ensuring a contest defined by contrasting styles, streaks, and momentum swings.

Devin Booker returns to the Three-Point Contest as one of the more experienced shooters in the field, bringing back memorable performances from past All-Star Weekends. Although his current 3-point percentage this season is a career low, his pedigree and confidence with the deep ball keep him a threat on the racks. Booker won this event in 2018 and has made multiple appearances, which gives him both historical relevance and fan appeal. Expect him to lean on his rhythm and composure when the clock starts.

Rookie Kon Knueppel has quickly established himself as one of the league‚Äôs rising long-range threats with an excellent percentage this season. His inclusion in the contest marks a rare opportunity for a first-year player to compete for the title, and he‚Äôll aim to become the first rookie ever to win. Knueppel‚Äôs high volume and efficient shooting make him a serious contender right out of the gate. His youth and fearless shooting style will be fun to watch as he battles veterans.

Despite missing the entire NBA season with a torn Achilles, Damian Lillard will still suit up for the 3-Point Contest, a testament to his elite reputation as a marksman. Lillard is a two-time winner of this event and can tie the all-time record with his third title. His career 3-point scoring and clutch gene make him a perennial fan favorite, regardless of in-season play. Lillard‚Äôs participation adds a compelling storyline of resilience and competitive pride.

Tyrese Maxey enters the contest riding a breakout season as one of the NBA‚Äôs most dynamic scorers, combining pace with deep shooting prowess. This will be his first appearance in the Three-Point Contest, aligning with his first All-Star starter nod. Maxey‚Äôs ability to make tough catch-and-shoot attempts under pressure gives him a versatile edge on the racks. His confidence from downtown blends well with his overall offensive game, making him a dark-horse candidate.

Donovan Mitchell is another All-Star entering the contest with a reputation for confident and flashy deep shooting. As the Cavaliers‚Äô lead scorer, Mitchell blends volume with creativity, often pulling up from range in rhythm. His presence adds star power and competitive intensity to the field, especially when the spotlight gets bright. Expect Mitchell to attack the money balls with the same aggression he brings in late-game situations.

Jamal Murray brings his sharpshooting pedigree from both the regular season and playoff stages to the Three-Point Contest. Known for his calm demeanor and clutch threes, Murray complements Stephen Curry‚Äôs shooting leadership in Denver‚Äôs offense. This appearance aligns with his first All-Star selection, showcasing his ascent among the league‚Äôs premier perimeter scorers. Given his range and confidence, he can heat up quickly when the rack lights turn on.

Veteran forward Bobby Portis Jr. earned his first 3-Point Contest nod thanks to a breakout shooting season, boasting one of the highest percentages among contestants. His stride into elite floor spacing has helped Milwaukee‚Äôs offense evolve, making him more than a traditional big man. Portis‚Äô smooth release and catch-and-shoot rhythm make him a legitimate threat in this format. His inclusion underscores how modern bigs can impact spacing and contest formats alike.

Norman Powell enters the event as an All-Star and one of Miami‚Äôs most reliable 3-point shooters this season. His shooting profile blends athleticism with catch-and-shoot efficiency, and he has experience from prior contests as well. Powell‚Äôs ability to get hot in spurts could make him dangerous in the rapid-fire rhythm of the 3-Point Contest. As a player who thrives in momentum, he‚Äôll look to heat up early and carry it through the rounds.

When the final rack is emptied on Saturday, February 14 at 5:00 p.m. ET, the 2026 Three‚ÄëPoint Contest is sure to hinge on rhythm, confidence, and a competitor‚Äôs ability to perform under the clock. With this blend of elite scorers, specialists, and fearless newcomers all taking aim at the same moment, the difference between victory and elimination could be a single swish or miss. No matter who hoists the title at the State Farm 3‚ÄëPoint Contest, this field underscores how deep shooting continues to define the modern NBA and why this event remains one of All‚ÄëStar Weekend‚Äôs most anticipated traditions.

title: Kevin Johnson Entered a Church to Pray Before Guarding Michael Jordan in the NBA Finals
description: Guarding Michael Jordan never felt more like a death sentence than it did for Kevin Johnson during the 1993 NBA Finals. Johnson has long stated how he feels terrible about how Charles Barkley is ringless due to that Finals.
fullText:
Guarding Michael Jordan never felt more like a death sentence than it did for Kevin Johnson during the 1993 NBA Finals. Johnson has long stated how he feels terrible about how Charles Barkley is ringless due to that Finals. However, with MJ on the other end of the court, perhaps that was inevitable?

The ‚Äô93 Finals had several intersecting and interesting storylines. One was the fact that Jordannever saw Dan Majerle as a threat. Dan was propped up to be a ‚ÄòJordan stopper‚Äô of sorts but this didn‚Äôt move the needle for him in the slightest.

Games 1 and 2 saw Jordan score a total of 73 points and the Bulls go up 2-0 with Majerle guarding ‚ÄòHis Airness‚Äô. The Suns coaching staff saw this as a clear misstep and defensive deficiency. Their next course of action? Have Kevin Johnson take up the task.

‚ÄúI walk straight in that church and I sit in the front row. I‚Äôm like, ‚ÄòJesus, I don‚Äôt believe in you no more,‚Äô‚Äù saidJohnson the Club520 podcast. The concept of having to defend Michael in the Finals was so unfathomable for KJ that he, at first, believed he had dreamt it.

When he told MJ during Game 3‚Äôs jumpball that he was guarding him, the latter‚Äôs reaction was a mere ‚ÄúHuh?‚Äù

Funnily enough, the Suns ended up winning Game 3 in triple overtime despite Jordan‚Äôs 44. Johnson was no scrub however as he held his own on the offensive end as well, going 11-24 from the field and having 25 points on the night.

The Suns won two out of their three games in Chicago but would eventually lose Game 6, leading to the Bulls winning their third straight title.

Kevin is still quite proud of the way he guarded Mike though, saying ‚ÄúTake that Mike!‚Äù on the podcast when speaking on keeping MJ below the scoring average he had when guarded by Dan.

title: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander's 2026 NBA All-Star replacement revealed
description: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander's 2026 NBA All-Star replacement revealed.
fullText:
For the first time in four years, Shai Gilgeous-Alexander won't participate at NBA All-Star weekend. Once he was ruled out through the break with an abdominal strain, the reigning MVP's absence let out some air from the balloon in a three-day event that highlights the league's best players.

Alperen Sengun has replaced Gilgeous-Alexander as a 2026 NBA All-Star injury replacement. He will take his spot on Team World in the three-team round-robin tournament that replaces Sunday's traditional All-Star Game.

Sengun's NBA All-Star teammates are Nikola Jokic, Giannis Antetokounmpo, Luka Doncic, Victor Wembanyama, Karl-Anthony Towns, Jamal Murray, Deni Avdija and Pascal Siakam.

Sengun joins teammate Kevin Durant for the star-studded event. Both will represent the Houston Rockets. Just yesterday, the hospital Oklahoma City Thunder dropped a 112-106 loss to them. Sengun had a 17-point, 12-rebound and 11-assist triple-double.

The Thunder continue to voyage through Gilgeous-Alexander's absence. So far, they're 0-2 in a five-game stretch. Never ideal to be without your best player, but sacrificing five games for three weeks off is pretty economical.

The Thunder will still be part of the NBA All-Star weekend extravaganza. Chet Holmgren will be part of Team USA stars. His teammates are Anthony Edwards, Cade Cunningham, Devin Booker, Tyrese Maxey, Scottie Barnes, Jalen Johnson and Jalen Duren.

This article originally appeared on OKC Thunder Wire: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander's 2026 NBA All-Star replacement revealed

title: Apologetic Turkish center Sengun replaces Shai as NBA All-Star
description: Turkish center Alperen Sengun of the Houston Rockets¬†was named to replace injured Shai Gilgeous-Alexander on the World Team for next week's NBA All-Star tournament, the league announced on Sunday.NBA commissioner Adam Silver, who makes all injury replacements for the All-Star event, selected Sengun to replace Gilgeous-Alexander, the reigning Most Valuable Player for reigning NBA champion and league leader Oklahoma City.
fullText:
Turkish center Alperen Sengun of the Houston Rockets¬†was named to replace injured Shai Gilgeous-Alexander on the World Team for next week's NBA All-Star tournament, the league announced on Sunday.

NBA commissioner Adam Silver, who makes all injury replacements for the All-Star event, selected Sengun to replace Gilgeous-Alexander, the reigning Most Valuable Player for reigning NBA champion and league leader Oklahoma City.

Sengun's call-up came a day after he apologized for repeatedly calling referee Jenna Reneau a "bitch" in Houston's 114-93 loss to Boston on Wednesday, for which he was ejected from the contest.

Sengun said following Saturday's 112-106 victory at Oklahoma City that he had apologized to Reneau just after Wednesday's game,¬†saying he "felt bad" about the "immature" remark and "should have known better," saying it would never happen again.

Canadian star Gilgeous-Alexander has been sidelined by an abdominal strain but was voted a starter in taking his fourth All-Star selection in a row.

The 75th NBA All-Star Game will be played next Sunday at Intuit Dome, home of the Los Angeles Clippers.

Sengun was named an All-Star for the first time last year. In his fifth NBA campaign, Sengun is averaging 20.8 points, 9.4 rebounds, and 6.3 assists over 44 games.

Sengun has helped the Rockets to a 32-19 record, sharing fourth place in the Western Conference.

In a revamped All-Star format, the World squad will face two teams of American players, USA Stars and USA Stripes, in a round-robin mini-tournament with three 12-minute games deciding which two sides advance to the 12-minute final.

title: Isaiah Collier continues to make the most of his opportunity
description: Isaiah Collier is evolving in the NBA. He is making a great case for being one of the Utah Jazz's building blocks of the future
fullText:
One of the best stories recently in the NBA has been second-year former Trojan Isaiah Collier continuing to make the most of his opportunities. After Collier's career night, dishing out 22 assists, 17 points, and 3 steals, Collier built off that and led his team in scoring.

The Jazz have been without Keyonte George, and Collier is making up for the majority of his impact. Collier last night had a team-high 25 points, 11 assists, and 3 steals again. Collier has now had 5 straight games with a steal and a combined 13 steals in that span. It is not just his scoring output or his ability to find his teammates for good looks; he is also quite the defender.

Collier is becoming more and more of a polished all-around basketball player. Any team, regardless of how deep the rotation is, can use a guy like Collier. He is proving to be extremely valuable for this team moving forward.

The Jazz are not looking to win games this season, even after the trade for star forward Jaren Jackson Jr. and ascending young players. This team wants a shot at a top pick in the upcoming draft. This upcoming class is full of stars. Yet when you are not trying to win, it is important to allow your young guys an opportunity to develop and see which players will be building blocks for the future.

Now, after his recent great production in his starts, Collier is proving to be one of the pieces for the Utah Jazz moving forward. He is now averaging 10 points, 7.1 assists per contest, and shooting 50% from the field. He may not likely be a starting player for the Jazz when this lineup is ready to contend, but he has definitely shown he will be a key contributor in the rotation. Heck, he has shown he can be a player that steps up when stars go down with injury.

The Utah Jazz are building some special, and part of that is because of how great the former USC Trojan Isaiah Collier has been this season. The Jazz may not get any real success this season, but the next season should be one in which conversations about the Jazz look very different.

This article originally appeared on Trojans Wire: Isaiah Collier is enhancing USC basketball brand in NBA with Jazz

title: NBA MVP odds as of February 6, 2026
description: The NBA MVP race is beginning to take real shape, with clear frontrunners separating themselves as the season moves past its midpoint. Betting odds now reflect not just raw statistics, but team success, narrative momentum, and nightly impact across the‚Ä¶
fullText:
The NBA MVP race is beginning to take real shape, with clear frontrunners separating themselves as the season moves past its midpoint. Betting odds now reflect not just raw statistics, but team success, narrative momentum, and nightly impact across the league. From established superstars to rising faces driving unexpected contenders, the MVP conversation is deeper than it first appears.

Shai Gilgeous-Alexander sits comfortably atop the MVP futures market after back-to-back elite seasons and leading Oklahoma City to one of the league‚Äôs best records. His scoring prowess and all-around impact have triggered MVP buzz, and he‚Äôs continued to show growth as a facilitator and defender. The narrative around SGA as a legitimate back-to-back MVP contender has only strengthened as the Thunder emerge as a true title contender. Voters often reward both team success and statistical dominance, and he delivers on both fronts.

Nikola Jokiƒá remains one of the most uniquely dominant players in NBA history ‚Äî a perennial MVP presence with a rare combination of scoring, playmaking and rebounding for a center. Even with Denver not topping the standings, his efficiency and court vision keep him squarely in the award conversation. Jokic‚Äôs ability to influence winning in so many statistical areas makes him irresistible to a certain slice of voters. His experience and broad skill set mean he can surge late if Nuggets‚Äô team performance improves.

Luka Donƒçiƒá continues his MVP-caliber rise in Los Angeles, producing gaudy scoring, assist and rebound numbers night after night. His March and April performances often define MVP narratives, and if he carries the Lakers deep into the standings, his odds will tighten. Donƒçiƒá‚Äôs marketability and high-usage role give him a real story appeal with voters ‚Äî a flashy star leading an iconic franchise. Sustained excellence and healthy availability position him as the most compelling challenger behind the favorites.

Cade Cunningham has steadily climbed MVP boards by turning Detroit into an unexpectedly strong team in the East. His balance of scoring, playmaking, and defensive improvement has transformed the Pistons into a top-tier squad. While Pistons‚Äô overall reputation may lag behind some contenders, Cunningham‚Äôs leadership is undeniable. Should Detroit continue exceeding expectations, he stands to benefit significantly in MVP voting.

Jaylen Brown‚Äôs MVP case hinges on Boston‚Äôs success and consistency as a top East seed while carrying increased offensive responsibility. A gifted two-way wing, Brown‚Äôs metrics often reflect efficient scoring and defensive impact. If he sustains high usage with balanced efficiency and Celtics stay elite, his narrative will improve. Voters may reward his often underappreciated contributions if Brown becomes the clear focal point of a championship-level team.

Tyrese Maxey‚Äôs odds are long primarily due to team context ‚Äî a 76ers squad that has struggled for consistency ‚Äî but his individual production has been impressive. Known for his scoring outbursts and clutch shooting, Maxey can light up the stat sheet any night. For MVP consideration, sustained team success is critical, which currently limits his market position. Still, as a budding star, Maxey‚Äôs profile could rise if Philly shifts toward a more impactful regular season.

Anthony Edwards has the raw star talent to climb MVP boards ‚Äî elite scoring, athleticism and flair for big moments ‚Äî but his MVP odds reflect team inconsistencies and limited playoff expectations. If Minnesota makes a leap into the top echelon of the West, his value proposition improves dramatically. Edwards‚Äô personality and highlight-level scoring give him a narrative edge, but MVP voters typically balance that with team success. Watch for late-season surges to flip his standing.

Jalen Brunson‚Äôs MVP floor rests more on his excellence than his current team‚Äôs record position ‚Äî the Knicks‚Äô defensive identity doesn‚Äôt always translate to traditional MVP narratives. As a steady veteran leader with efficient scoring and playmaking, Brunson ticks many boxes, though sustaining this into MVP consideration requires Knicks to inch into elite territory. His narrative hinges on exceeding expectations with a gritty, team-first profile.

Donovan Mitchell‚Äôs MVP odds reflect Cavs‚Äô standing as competitive but not among the league‚Äôs elite, limiting his case despite strong perimeter scoring. Known for explosive offense, Mitchell still needs a breakout franchise season to garner MVP traction. If Cleveland shocks top franchises and Mitchell pushes them, his narrative could shift. Right now, he represents a long-shot with scoring appeal but modest MVP viability.

Kawhi Leonard‚Äôs MVP odds are more symbolic than realistic ‚Äî injuries and limited availability make sustained MVP candidacy unlikely. When healthy, he‚Äôs a two-time Finals MVP and perennial All-Star with elite two-way impact. However, MVP awards rarely go to players with restricted games, especially given Clippers‚Äô middling results. Leonard‚Äôs narrative is better suited to playoff impact than regular-season hardware.

While the odds suggest a favorite, the MVP race is far from settled, especially with months of high-leverage basketball still ahead. Late-season surges, injuries, and shifts in the standings can dramatically reshape voter perception. As history has shown, the final stretch often decides who turns elite production into league-wide recognition.

The post NBA MVP odds as of February 6, 2026 appeared first on The Big Lead.

title: Clippers Shock the NBA With Fire Sale at the Trade Deadline
description: The Los Angeles Clippers were one of the hottest teams in the NBA heading into the trade deadline, and nobody saw what came next.
fullText:
The Los Angeles Clippers were one of the hottest teams in the NBA heading into the trade deadline, and nobody saw what came next.

After rattling off a 16-3 stretch that pulled them from the bottom of the Western Conference standings all the way into play-in position, the front office decided to blow it up.

In the span of just a few days, the Clippers moved their second- and third-best players, James Harden and Ivica Zubac, turning what looked like a late-season push into a full-blown rebuild on the fly.

The Clippers now sit at 23-27 on the season and are left with more questions than answers as they head into All-Star Weekend as the host team at Intuit Dome.

The first domino fell on Tuesday when the Clippers sent 11-time All-Star James Harden to the Cleveland Cavaliers in exchange for two-time All-Star Darius Garland and a second-round pick.

Harden had been the engine that kept Los Angeles afloat all season, averaging 25.4 points and 8.1 assists per game while carrying the team through a brutal 6-21 start.

He was having his best scoring season in six years, so the move caught almost everyone off guard.

BREAKING: The Los Angeles Clippers are trading James Harden to the Cleveland Cavaliers for Darius Garland and a second-round pick, sources tell ESPN. Prolific swap of the star point guards. pic.twitter.com/IHhhhabJnX

‚Äî Shams Charania (@ShamsCharania) February 4, 2026

For the Clippers, though, it was about looking ahead.

Garland is 10 years younger than Harden and is locked into a long-term deal that runs through 2028-29.

He is recovering from a toe injury that has kept him out since January 14, but when healthy he is a strong scorer and playmaker who averaged 20.6 points and 6.7 assists last season.

Clippers president Lawrence Frank said the team is "trying to get younger while continuing to win," and Garland fits that goal on both ends.

The Clippers were not done there. On Thursday, they sent starting center Ivica Zubac and forward Kobe Brown to the Indiana Pacers in a deal that brought back a big haul of young talent and draft picks.

Los Angeles received Bennedict Mathurin, Isaiah Jackson, two first-round picks and a second-round pick in return.

FULL TRADE DETAILS:

Pacers receive:
Ivica Zubac
Kobe Brown

Clippers receive:
Benedict Mathurin
Isaiah Jackson
2 1st-round picks
2nd-round pick pic.twitter.com/iCAvemn9ls

‚Äî Legion Hoops (@LegionHoops) February 5, 2026

Zubac had been the longest-tenured Clipper on the roster, having joined the team back in 2019 after being traded from the cross-town rival Los Angeles Lakers.

He was putting up 14.4 points and 11.0 rebounds per game this season while shooting over 61 percent from the floor, and he was coming off a career year in 2024-25 that earned him All-Defensive Second Team honors.

The centerpiece coming back is Mathurin, a 23-year-old wing who has been averaging 17.8 points per game this season and gives Los Angeles the kind of young scoring talent they will need going forward.

The draft capital is a big part of this, too. The Pacers' 2026 first-round pick is protected 1-4 and 10-30, which means the Clippers only get it if it falls between the fifth and ninth picks.

Indiana currently has one of the worst records in the league, so there is close to a coin flip chance it lands in that range. If it does not, it turns into an unprotected 2031 first-rounder from Indiana, and the Clippers also picked up an unprotected 2029 first from the Pacers.

What makes the timing so shocking is that the Clippers had just gone on that incredible 16-3 run and seemed to have real momentum going.

The Clippers pivoted HARD and turned James Harden and Ivica Zubac into:

- Darius Garland
- Bennedict Mathurin
- Two first-round picks, including a potential lottery pick.

Hats off to the front office.

‚Äî Grant "Money" Mona (@Gmona48) February 5, 2026

They had the oldest roster in the NBA this season with six core players aged 31 or older, and the front office clearly decided that a possible first-round exit in the playoffs was not worth passing up the chance to get younger and stockpile assets.

Kawhi Leonard will remain with the team for now, but his future in Los Angeles will be a major talking point this offseason.

For a franchise that came into the year swinging for the fences with a veteran-heavy roster, this was a pivot that nobody expected, and the ripple effects will be felt for years to come.

For now, though, it is a new era in Inglewood.

title: Charlotte Hornets waive former NBA Champion guard
description: Charlotte continues to shuffle its roster ahead of tomorrow's trade deadline.
fullText:
Charlotte Hornets waive former NBA Champion guard originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Charlotte Hornets have waived guard Pat Connaughton, the team announced Wednesday night.

Connaughton has played in 22 games this season, averaging 2.9 points and 1.4 rebounds. He's shot a career-high 40.7% from three in his limited action.

The move opens a roster spot for guard Tyus Jones, who the Hornets acquired from the Orlando Magic on Wednesday.

More:Former Hornets center could be on the move from Phoenix

Connaughton was on a $9.4 million contract, which expires if he's not claimed by another team within two days.

It's been another busy trade deadline for Hornets General Manager Jeff Peterson. Charlotte also acquired Coby White from the Chicago Bulls for Collin Sexton and sent Mason Plumlee to the Oklahoma City Thunder.

The moves give the Hornets more depth in the backcourt behind star guards LaMelo Ball and Kon Knueppel. Veteran guard Tre Mann is also on the roster but has seen a diminished role this season.

This was Connaughton's first season in Charlotte after being acquired from the Milwaukee Bucks last July. The Hornets sent Vasilije Micic to Milwaukee for Connaughton and two second-round picks.

He's best known for his seven-year run with the Bucks, where he won an NBA Championship in 2021. He was a steady contributor in Milwaukee, playing 20+ minutes per game in five seasons.

Connaughton, an 11-year NBA veteran, could be a solid depth addition for a contending team. He's shot over 37% from three in four seasons and has plenty of playoff experience.

It remains to be seen if Peterson and Charlotte will make more moves ahead of Thursday's deadline. Center could be a position to monitor, as the Hornets only have two centers on standard contracts.

title: ‚ÄúWe Want You Back‚Äù: Anthony Edwards Sends Heartfelt Message to ‚ÄúOG‚Äù Mike Conley
description: It‚Äôs that time of year in the NBA when goodbyes echo around the league, with teammates forced to bid farewell to some of the most influential figures in the locker room. For Anthony Edwards in 2025, it meant saying goodbye to Mike Conley Jr.
fullText:
It‚Äôs that time of year in the NBA when goodbyes echo around the league, with teammates forced to bid farewell to some of the most influential figures in the locker room. For Anthony Edwards in 2025, it meant saying goodbye to Mike Conley Jr., a veteran who had been instrumental in the Minnesota Timberwolves‚Äô recent rise in the league.

Conley had a rollercoaster 24 hours. He was first traded to the Chicago Bulls, who just one day later, sent him to the Charlotte Hornets. But that may not be the end of this trade-deadline adventure, as there‚Äôs a chance he may have to pack his bags again.

Edwards, after the Timberwolves‚Äô victory over the Toronto Raptors earlier today, admitted to hearing that the organization can try to get him back. As a result, he decided to do his part.

Conley joined the Wolvesin 2023 and quickly became one of the leaders in the locker room as they made two trips to the Conference Finals. In particular, helped Edwards a lot when he was struggling.

‚ÄúMike man, he‚Äôs an OG. Always helped me when I was struggling on court. Great conversations off the court, great dude overall,‚Äù Edwards said.

The trade deadline day can be brutal. Players who have been comfortable in a city for years may be forced to move to the other side of the country and turn their lives upside down in a matter of hours. For Conley, he‚Äôs already traveled from Minneapolis to Chicago and on to Charlotte.

So, due to the Andrew Bogut rule, given that he‚Äôs been traded twice in the span of 24 hours, he can now return to the original team that he left. Seem as though Edwards keeps hoping that he flies right back home.

‚ÄúI keep hearing he can come back, so hopefully he will, and I hope he sees this,‚Äù Edwards said. ‚ÄúWe want you back, Mike. He knows we miss him.‚Äù

The Timberwolves organization would ideally love to bring someone of Conley‚Äôs stature back. He wasn‚Äôt playing much in 25/26, but had an invaluable veteran presence. And if Edwards, arguably the cornerstone of Minnesota, asks the front office to try to make a move for him again, they would at least give it a try.

The post ‚ÄúWe Want You Back‚Äù: Anthony Edwards Sends Heartfelt Message to ‚ÄúOG‚Äù Mike Conley appeared first on The SportsRush.

title: What Are the Best Player Rivalries In the NBA Today?
description: Rivalries are the backbone of the NBA. Rivals Week just passed, but the lineup wasn‚Äôt up to par. Some fan-favorite matchups are missing, such as the Spurs and Thunder, or the historic Celtics and Lakers, built off the backs of Magic Johnson and Larry Bird. Player rivalries build team rivalries. Seeing players go head-to-head to [‚Ä¶] The post What Are the Best Player Rivalries In the NBA Today?
fullText:
Rivalries are the backbone of the NBA. Rivals Week just passed, but the lineup wasn‚Äôt up to par. Some fan-favorite matchups are missing, such as the Spurs and Thunder, or the historic Celtics and Lakers, built off the backs of Magic Johnson and Larry Bird.

Player rivalries build team rivalries. Seeing players go head-to-head to prove who‚Äôs the best is what makes the NBA the most entertaining.

With that being said, here are the four best player rivalries currently taking place in the NBA:

Anytime Lebron faces off with Steph Curry or Kevin Durant, it‚Äôs still a marquee matchup. LeBron, Durant, and Curry are a callback to an era now passed. Every time the NBA begins a new season, fans know they are that much closer to these show-stopping battles are coming to an end.

That means every game is a must-watch. When any combination of these three go head-to-head, it‚Äôs apparent how badly they each want to come out victorious over the other.

From Finals matchups to random regular-season contests, each of the three give their all when they step on the court against each other.

A different side of LeBron comes out when he faces Dillon Brooks. We‚Äôve never seen a player get under the King‚Äôs skin like the Phoenix Suns guard. This rivalry has been filled with trash talk, physical confrontations, and heated moments.

Brooks is averaging a career high of 21.1 points per game and elevates his play every time he goes up against the Lakers. Los Angeles‚Äô last matchup with the Suns ended in a blowout.

It seems like Brooks has made it his personal mission to mess with the Hall of Famer, and fans are eagerly awaiting their next duel.

Chet Holmgren going up against Victor Wembanyama has been one of the NBA‚Äôs most compelling feuds as of late.

Since Wembanyama entered the NBA, he and Chet have had a budding rivalry. The two towering figures first faced off in the 2021 FIBA World Cup, where Holmgren and Team USA walked out with the win.

The Spurs seem to have the Thunder‚Äôs number this year, as they‚Äôve beaten them three times this season. It feels like Wembanyama circles every Thunder game on his calendar.

Wembanyama is on a mission to prove he‚Äôs far and away the best young center in the NBA. The Spurs‚Äô phenom is a generational talent, but Holmgren has something he doesn‚Äôt: a championship ring.

Edwards Vs. SGA is a heavyweight fight with the title for best guard in the NBA on the line. The intensity always reaches a fever pitch when these two play each other. The two players mirror each other in many ways. Both became leaders of their team at a relatively young age and became stars around the same time.

Ant and SGA have taken subtle shots at each other through shoe commercials. It‚Äôs clear they both have immense respect for each other, but are fighting to be the best. The Timberwolves have won two out of three matchups with the Thunder this season, but these two will be battling it out for years to come.

Attention player haters and disbelievers of all kinds‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/5tzoBwvUZ4

‚Äî adidas Basketball (@adidasHoops) October 24, 2025

The post What Are the Best Player Rivalries In the NBA Today? appeared first on The Lead.

title: Sophie Cunningham reacts to Reggie Miller's player comp for Caitlin Clark
description: Who would Caitlin Clark's NBA player comp be? The one Reggie Miller chose may have come from left field.
fullText:
Reggie Miller was effusive in his praise for Caitlin Clark on Sunday night "Basketball Night in America" during a pregame conversation on NBC.

The Indiana Pacers legend said he would relinquish his unofficial "best shooter in Indiana" title to the Indiana Fever star and Tyrese Haliburton of the Pacers.

Miller then offered an NBA player comp for Clark that caught a lot of people off guard: Payton Pritchard of the Boston Celtics. Both are prolific outside shooters and strong ball handlers, but Clark is a focal point for the WNBA, while Pritchard is a complementary player.

On the labor talks: Cunningham says the WNBA is 'laughingstock of sports'

"I personally love Reggie. ... I don't think he meant any harm by it, but I do think, like, probably not the best comparison for the generational player that Caitlin is," Cunningham said on her "Show Me Something" podcast. "I don't think she took it personal."

Reggie Miller‚Äôs comp for Caitlin Clark was‚Ä¶ probably not the best choice possible pic.twitter.com/Yn8WhriTt6

title: LeBron James reveals late WWE legend inspired his ‚ÄòJoker‚Äô villain role with Miami Heat
description: LeBron James has offered a fascinating insight into how a legendary WWE heel turn helped shape one of the most controversial chapters of his NBA career. After all, the Los Angeles Lakers star explained that his time with the Miami Heat was influenced by an unlikely wrestling icon.
fullText:
LeBron James has offered a fascinating insight into how a legendary WWE heel turn helped shape one of the most controversial chapters of his NBA career.

After all, the Los Angeles Lakers star explained that his time with the Miami Heat was influenced by an unlikely wrestling icon.

James‚Äô decision to embrace the villain role after leaving Cleveland in 2010 transformed how fans viewed him, and he has since acknowledged that the reaction was not only anticipated but studied.

Speaking on a recent episode of the Mind the Game podcast, LeBron revealed that the late WWE legend Hulk Hogan played a key role in how he understood fame, backlash, and reinvention.

‚ÄúI grew up watching Hulk Hogan. At one point, Hulk Hogan was like America, as everyone loved him. What it means to be an American.

Then one day, he went to N.W.O. and people couldn‚Äôt understand how he tagged up with the enemy,‚Äù James said.

He added: ‚ÄúThey were like, ‚ÄòWhat is going on?‚Äô Everybody just booed him. He went from wearing red and yellow to black and white.‚Äù

Hogan‚Äôs infamous switch from beloved hero to villain in the 1990s stunned wrestling fans and redefined his career.

LeBron saw clear parallels when he joined forces with Dwyane Wade and Chris Bosh in Miami, a move that instantly made him the league‚Äôs most polarising figure.

LeBron explained that accepting the villain label was partly about understanding entertainment as much as competition.

‚ÄúOne, we‚Äôre entertainers as well‚Ä¶ Listen, we want to go out and have fun, smile and be happy because that‚Äôs what brings us joy,‚Äù James continued.

He concluded, stating: ‚ÄúBut we can tap into the Joker role if y‚Äôall make us, now. We can get there too now, and still be able to perform at a high level.‚Äù

During his Miami Heat years, James leaned into the boos, the black uniforms, and the perception that he was basketball‚Äôs ultimate antagonist.

Rather than fighting public sentiment, he channelled it. The result was one of the most dominant stretches of his career, with championships, MVPs, and a sharpened edge that defined a new version of LeBron.

Much like Hogan‚Äôs transformation elevated professional wrestling, LeBron‚Äôs embrace of the villain role reshaped the NBA‚Äôs modern era. It was controversial, deliberate, and ultimately successful.

title: NBA: First-time All-Stars for 2025-2026 season
description: The 2025‚Äì26 NBA season delivered a fresh wave of breakout stars, with six players earning their first All-Star selections through sustained growth and undeniable impact. Each of these players took a meaningful leap, either by expanding their offensive responsibilities, anchoring‚Ä¶
fullText:
The 2025‚Äì26 NBA season delivered a fresh wave of breakout stars, with six players earning their first All-Star selections through sustained growth and undeniable impact. Each of these players took a meaningful leap, either by expanding their offensive responsibilities, anchoring a defense, or becoming indispensable to their team‚Äôs identity. Together, they represent the league‚Äôs constant evolution and the reward that comes from opportunity meeting preparation.

Deni Avdija breaks new ground as one of the league‚Äôs most complete two-way forwards this season. His All-Star nod reflects a career-high scoring uptick and unprecedented playmaking for a Trail Blazers forward, putting him among the rare players averaging 25+ points, 7+ rebounds, and 6+ assists. Beyond the counting stats, Avdija‚Äôs selection is historic: he‚Äôs the first NBA All-Star from Israel, showcasing his rapid ascent and growing global impact. His versatile game has been a key factor for Portland‚Äôs competitiveness this season.

Jalen Duren has emerged as a true interior force for the Detroit Pistons, anchoring both ends of the court with energy and efficiency. This first All-Star selection comes as a result of his elite rebounding and inside scoring, where he ranks among the league‚Äôs best in key paint-dominant metrics. Duren‚Äôs physicality sets the tone for Detroit defensively, and his offensive improvements have made him a reliable secondary scoring option. His trajectory suggests he could become one of the NBA‚Äôs premier big men for years to come.

Chet Holmgren‚Äôs All-Star breakthrough signifies the Thunder‚Äôs rise defensively and his unique impact on both ends of the floor. In just his third NBA season, he‚Äôs developed into a disruptive rim protector while continuing to expand his scoring and rebounding prowess. Holmgren‚Äôs combination of size, agility, and shooting range makes him a matchup problem and a centerpiece of OKC‚Äôs identity. His inclusion among the league‚Äôs elite this year highlights how integral he‚Äôs become to his team‚Äôs success

Back at full health after a season cut short by injury, Jalen Johnson has taken a massive leap to become one of the Hawks‚Äô central playmakers. His All-Star selection reflects career-high production across scoring, rebounding, and facilitating, with a rare all-around stat line that puts him in elite company. Johnson‚Äôs athleticism and versatility have given Atlanta a multi-dimensional threat on offense and a disruptive presence on defense. This first All-Star appearance underscores his growth into a franchise cornerstone.

Jamal Murray‚Äôs first All-Star nod comes after years of high-impact performances that previously went unrecognized in the midseason showcase. This season represents a personal best on both ends of the court, where he‚Äôs set new marks in scoring, assists, and shooting efficiency. Murray‚Äôs knack for clutch play and generating offense has been vital for the Nuggets, especially during stretches without Nikola Jokiƒá. His breakthrough honors reflect the high-level consistency he‚Äôs brought to Denver‚Äôs lineup.

At 32 years old, Norman Powell‚Äôs first All-Star selection is a testament to perseverance and gradual refinement of his game. In Miami, Powell has become a primary scoring threat, putting up career-best numbers while leading one of the highest-scoring offenses in the league. His sharpshooting and ability to take over games in isolation have made him an X-factor for the Heat. This long-awaited recognition rewards years of hard-earned development and situational excellence.

These first-time All-Stars didn‚Äôt arrive by accident; their selections reflect seasons defined by consistency, resilience, and expanded roles. From young cornerstones announcing their arrival to veterans finally receiving overdue recognition, this group captures multiple paths to All-Star status. As the league continues to shift, the 2025‚Äì26 class stands as a snapshot of the NBA‚Äôs next phase and the players shaping it.

title: Kawhi Leonard named to NBA All-Star Game as late add: What to know
description: Kawhi Leonard has been picked to the NBA All-Star Game by commissioner Adam Silver as a late addition, the league announced Tuesday.
fullText:
The Intuit Dome will have an All-Star playing on his home floor, after all.

Los Angeles Clippers star Kawhi Leonard has been named to the NBA All-Star Game by commissioner Adam Silver, the league announced Tuesday afternoon. Leonard was originally left off the roster after he wasn't voted in by the fans, media or players as a starter or coaches as a reserve, but the teams were a player short under the new format.

This year's All-Star Game will be "USA vs. the World." Three teams -- two teams of American players and one team of international players -- will compete against each other in a round robin-style tournament on Sunday, Feb. 15. Leonard's addition brings the total number of U.S. All-Stars to 16, the minimum required.

There was some backlash online after Leonard, who's averaging a career-high 27.6 points per game, 6.1 rebounds, 3.6 assists and a league-leading 2.06 steals in 36 games played this season.¬† He's also been as efficient as he's ever been, shooting 49.7%, 39.1% from three-point range and has the fourth-best free throw percentage in the league at 91.3%.

This will be Leonard's seventh career All-Star selection.

Per the NBA's statement, the All-Star teams will be revealed at 4 p.m. PT Tuesday night on Peacock during the pregame show ahead of the Boston Celtics-Dallas Mavericks game.

This article originally appeared on USA TODAY: Los Angeles Clippers star Kawhi Leonard selected for NBA All-Star Game

title: Clippers‚Äô Kawhi Leonard Added to NBA West All-Star Roster
description: Los Angeles Clippers superstar Kawhi Leonard was considered to be one of the most shocking omission from the 2026 NBA West All-Star roster this season. When the reserve players for both conferences were announced on Sunday, the list did not‚Ä¶
fullText:
Los Angeles Clippers superstar Kawhi Leonard was considered to be one of the most shocking omission from the 2026 NBA West All-Star roster this season. When the reserve players for both conferences were announced on Sunday, the list did not include Leonard.

But on Tuesday, Leonard was added to the Western Conference‚Äôs roster, according to NBA insider Shams Charania. Leonard is the 16th U.S. All-Star, which is the minimum requirement. The initial group of 24 All-Stars had only 15 U.S. All-Stars.

Los Angeles Clippers star Kawhi Leonard has been selected to the 2026 NBA All-Star Game. After the selection of the initial 24 All-Stars, Leonard was added to bring the total number of U.S. All-Stars to 16, the minimum required.

‚Äî Shams Charania (@ShamsCharania) February 3, 2026

Leonard will be a reserve player for the Western Conference alongside the following seven players:

Los Angeles Lakers forward LeBron James

Minnesota Timberwolves guard Anthony Edwards

Denver Nuggets guard Jamal Murray

Oklahoma City Thunder center Chet Holmgren

Houston Rockets forward Kevin Durant

Phoenix Suns guard Devin Booker

Portland Trail Blazers forward Deni Avdija

The West Conference starters will be Los Angeles Lakers forward-guard Luka Doncic, Oklahoma City Thunder guard Shai Gilgeous-Alexander, San Antonio Spurs forward Victor Wembanyama, Denver Nuggets center Nikola Jokiƒá and Golden State Warriors guard Stephen Curry.

This is Leonard‚Äôs seventh NBA All-Star selection of his career. He is the only Clippers player to have earned an All-Star selection this season.

The Western Conference is filled with superstars, but Leonard has been one of the top players in the NBA since defeating the Los Angeles Lakers on Dec. 20. He has led the Clippers out of a 6-21 rut and now the team is 23-26.

Although many believed Leonard should have been named an All-Star initially, the two-time NBA champion told reporters he was not expecting to earn the honor after the Clippers‚Äô game against the Philadelphia 76ers on Monday.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs never an expectation for me. I was a guy that had to work my way into those conversations. It is what it is. I‚Äôm gonna enjoy my time,‚Äù Leonard said, per Joey Linn on X.

Kawhi Leonard last night on his All-Star snub:

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs never an expectation for me. I was a guy that had to work my way into those conversations. It is what it is. I‚Äôm gonna enjoy my time.‚Äù

Would he have liked to be chosen:

‚ÄúYeah, of course. Every player does‚Ä¶ but they all‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/V68w1ZbC08

‚Äî Joey Linn (@joeylinn_) February 3, 2026

Now, Leonard is a 2026 All-Star and will have the opportunity to represent the Clippers in the All-Star Game that is taking place at the Intuit Dome.
